    • Field Detail

      • MAX_DEPTH

        private static final int MAX_DEPTH
        The maximum depth allowed for an object. This is used to avoid the StackOverflowError due to possibility of recurse too deeply.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Serializer

        public Serializer()

    • Method Detail

      • serialize

        public static java.nio.ByteBuffer serialize(java.lang.Object... objects)
                                     throws SerializationException
        Method used to serialize a variable length list of objects into a ByteBuffer The primitives, primitives wrappers and String will be serialized as native. The others will be opened in a recurrent way.

        Important: Do not use this function to serialize circular objects or Java Collections. e.g. Circular Linked Lists.

        Parameters:
        objects - Variable object list to be serialized
        Returns:
        Objects serialized in a ByteBuffer
        Throws:
        SerializationException - In case that an error occurs

      • serializeObject

        private static void serializeObject(java.io.DataOutputStream outputStream,
                                    java.lang.Object inputObject,
                                    int currentDepth)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    SerializationException
        This method is used to serialize an object. The primitives, primitives wrappers and String will be serialized as native. The others will be opened in a recurrent way.

        Important: Do not use this function to serialize circular objects or Java Collections. e.g. Circular Linked Lists.

        Parameters:
        outputStream - DataOutputStream in which the serialized object is written
        inputObject - Abstract input object
        currentDepth - The current depth in the call stack
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Input/output exception
        SerializationException - Serialization exception

      • serializeArray

        private static void serializeArray(java.io.DataOutputStream outputStream,
                                   java.lang.Object inputArray,
                                   int currentDepth)
                            throws java.io.IOException,
                                   SerializationException
        Method used to serialize an array If it is an array of primitives it will be serialized as a single object, if it is an array of objects it will be serialized element by element (it will call serializeObject(element))

        Note: Can not be serialized arrays bigger than 1^31-1 elements

        Parameters:
        outputStream - DataOutputStream in which the serialized object is written
        inputArray - Abstract input array
        currentDepth - The current depth in the call stack
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Input/output exception
        SerializationException - Serialization exception

      • deserialize

        public static java.lang.Object[] deserialize(java.nio.ByteBuffer inputBuffer,
                                             java.lang.Class<?>... parameters)
                                      throws DeserializationException
        The method deserialize the inputBuffer into Object[] described by parameters.

        If there are not enough bytes in the input buffer, this method will throw an BufferUnderflowException

        Parameters:
        inputBuffer - input Buffer
        parameters - expected objects class
        Returns:
        deserialized objects
        Throws:
        DeserializationException - in case of error

      • deserializeObject

        private static java.lang.Object deserializeObject(java.nio.ByteBuffer inputBytes,
                                                  java.lang.Class<?> objectClass,
                                                  int currentDepth)
                                           throws DeserializationException
        This method will reads the necessary amount of bytes and will reconstruct the Object.
        Parameters:
        inputBytes - ByteArrayInputStream that contains the object (or more) serialized in bytes. The size of the array can be bigger that expected, but only the first bytes needed will be used. (e.g. only 4 bytes read from buffer if Integer is expected)
        objectClass - Class of the expected object (e.g. java.lang.String)
        currentDepth - The current depth in the call stack
        Returns:
        requested object or null in case of exception
        Throws:
        DeserializationException - If inputBytes does not contain enough information to deserialize objects defined in objectClass

      • deserializeArray

        private static java.lang.Object deserializeArray(java.nio.ByteBuffer inputBytes,
                                                 java.lang.Class<?> arrayClass,
                                                 int currentDepth)
                                          throws DeserializationException
        This method will reads the necessary amount of bytes and will reconstruct the Object.
        Parameters:
        inputBytes - ByteArrayInputStream that contains the object (or more) serialized in bytes. The size of the array can be bigger that expected, but only the first bytes needed will be used. (e.g. only 4 bytes read from buffer if Integer is expected)
        arrayClass - Class of the expected object (e.g. java.lang.int[])
        currentDepth - The current depth in the call stack
        Returns:
        requested object or null in case of exception
        Throws:
        DeserializationException - If inputBytes does not contain enough information to deserialize objects defined in objectClass
        java.lang.NullPointerException - If the inputBytes or objectClass is null.
